data.title: Very nice older hotel
data.text: This was a very nice place to stay for an overnight visit to Spokane.  It is close to the riverfront for walking and close/within the historic area of the city.  We walked everywhere.  Parking is off site but only a very short walk away.  The lobby was quite nice with an older ambiance feel.  The room we had was clean and comfortable.  Outside noises were not noticed.  There is an awesome athletic facility connected to this hotel that is free to use.  We checked it out, great equipment, but did not use it.  We did not stay for breakfast, not included, because we had to be on our way in the morning.

data.title: Great place!
data.text:
We drive regularly from Central Oregon to Montana. Our overnight stop is always at The Spokane Club. Great location. Walking distance to everything you need, including great restaurants. (I highly recommend the Wild Sage!)

There is a very nice restaurant on-site, with a good bar. Plus, as a hotel guest, you get to use the really nice gym at the Spokane Club for free.

data.title: Outdated rooms but great downtown location
data.text:
Excellent location if you want to be near downtown. There's even Starbucks is 2 blocks away, next door to Lululemon. 

The Spokane Club is a social and fitness club, as well as a hotel.  Apparently you don't have to be a member to stay here, and guests also get to use their fantastic fitness center (which we did not use or look at). The complex is located right at the edge of the downtown area, less than 2 blocks to the downtown center.

Our room was on the 4th floor (there's only 5 levels). It was a bit dated, as it could use a facelift. They had L'Occitane toiletry products, and plenty of towels. It was spacious and clean, and they even had a Keurig coffee maker and complimentary bottled water for us to enjoy.

Valet or self parking is $14 a day. 

Aside from the dated rooms, and the inconsistent water temperature of the shower, the hotel location and price we paid was very good.

data.title: Enjoyed my visit!
data.text:
Creaky floor in my bedroom on the fourth floor, older features and a bed that was in need of a mattress change (broken down on one side)
notwithstanding, I enjoyed my stay. 

When I came into my room the radio was softly playing jazz. I thought of Bing Crosby staying here (2 black and white glossy photos of him adorn the desk area). Both were candid shots I noticed. He is from Spokane but I am not sure he came back home much. He also spent time as a youth in Tacoma. 

The Jazz was a nice touch. 

I love older places that have been kept up. This one has. 

The dining room provided good food 
and the price is competitive. 

I was not able to try the work out facility though as hotel guests one may. I loved the in house barber shop, the breakfast nook and the friendliness of the staff. 

A member has to sponsor you to be able to stay here. Or you can use a reciprocal if you are a member somewhere else. 

Old world elegance in the heart of Spokane.

data.title: Leaves a little to be desired
data.text:
The Spokane Club is a very nice old facility, a bit dated but nice.  The rooms are small and somewhat stuffy.  My main complaint was that the bed was so hard it put my back out.  I must have pinched a nerve because it hurt  for several days.  I am writing a week later and have just recovered.  We did not eat dinner there, as we has another engagement, but it looked very nice and comfortable in the dining area.
The hotel staff was great.  Just the bed was really awful.

data.title: Perfect location for a quick trip.
data.text:
This is a great hotel in the heart of downtown Spokane. The location is great and I was easily able to walk everywhere I needed to go. 

The hotel itself has some rustic charm to it but the amenities are modern enough. Some of the rooms feel a little dated but they are roomy and comfortable. 

It seems like parts of the property are sort of stuck in limbo in the sense that they were modernized years ago so they don't quite match the classic design of the building but they also don't match some of the more modern touches they've added. Overall the staff and property were great. I would definitely stay here again.

data.title: Nice to be back
data.text:
I stay at the Spokane Club when I visit Spokane, usually two or three times a year. I'm always impressed with my reception. They remember me and welcome me back.
The rooms are always clean, with very comfy beds. Bathrooms are a bit small compared to newer or more expensive hotels, but always clean and functional. 
A local newspaper is provided each morning. 
The restaurant has a wonderful breakfast with their famous orange glazed rolls. (To die for!)
I'm never disappointed at the Club.

data.title: Very nice hotel with great service
data.text: First thing I noticed was the attentiveness of the staff.  Very friendly.  Hotel is in a grand old building with a distinct air of class surrounding it.  Rooms are nice, with a kuereg (sp?) coffee maker and coffee pods complimentary along with Dasani water.  Although it is on a busy street, the noise is not too disturbing.   The location is central to downtown and the centennial walking and biking trail.  Great for a morning walk.  It definitely provides good value for a stay in Spokane.

data.title: Classy place in great location
data.text: This small, exclusive inn is attached to the fitness club. Excellent location walking distance shops, restaurants & the amazing river front park and waterfalls.  Nice, but small lobby was not big enough or furnished for hanging around. We didn't try the restaurant, but it looked adequate.  Our corner room was good size, small bathroom/shower, adequate closet, queen bed that was not very comfortable.  Furniture a little rickety and heating system questionable but we finally figured out how to get a comfortable temperature..  So the classy feel you get upon arrival is taken down a notch in the room.  Parking across the street cost $14/day.  Very good fitness center, we used the pool for lap swimming, not crowded.  I'd stay here again but not sure the high price is quite worth it.

data.title: Special downtown experience with a quaint flavor.
data.text: I am a Spokane Club member and take advantage of all the fantastic amenities daily. I frequently suggest my out of town friends stay at the Spokane Club. Yes, the rooms are small and quaint, but the 125 year old historic building is so special. There is a fantastic workout facility included with your stay and you are welcome to experience all the classes and facilities. The restaurant and lounge are a delight. Small, quiet and intimate. If you want "late night action" you are a a 5 minute walk from the heart of downtown. Please enjoy our very special Spokane hidden treasure.

data.title: Spokane Club of Spokane
data.text: While we love the Spokane Club for events and it's a great place to work out with all of the updated equipment and a view of the river....the overnight accommodations feel like a stop back in time. The hotel staff are wonderful and we had a nice breakfast...but the rooms are dated and stuffy (even after opening the window and spraying room freshener) . Both the lounge and room service shut down early so you must leave the premises for a late night snack or cocktail. There is no vending machine for a pop or snack. There is a nice workout facility available to guests. We do love valet parking and that they have a complementary shuttle...but I would only staying in my room for sleeping only. The rooms although clean...are just not that nice. if you get the room for a bargain price...stay. if you have to pay more than $100.00..I would price shop.

data.title: Will stay again
data.text:
We stayed at the Spokane club Inn as my husband was playing in a handball tournament. We had a king size bed in the third floor. It was the most comfortable bed we have ever had in a hotel!!  When we entered the room there was soft jazz playing it was such a nice touch!  The room was small but nicely appointed. The bathroom was nothing fancy but served the purpose and was clean. The hotel it self had a lovely atmosphere - the stairwell was beautiful and one really had a feeling of its history. Our check in was very quick and pleasant. We utilized the valet parking which was very convenient as the parkade was a block away. The location was within a five minute walk of the downtown and close to shopping. It was very quite with little outside noise. We attended the lounge, was comfortable but nothing very special. The club members seem to have a good time with the bar tender. Service was good. 
We definitely recommend this for a comfortable stay and will being staying again!

data.title: Terrific hotel well-maintained and convenient
data.text: Spokane is a grand town in first half of the 20th century style. Big well built buildings--of which the private Spokane Club is one. While it is a members only club and athletic center you can rent a hotel room there as a guest. I've read that since they are renovating rooms one by one it's important to ask for a renovated one. We did and it was super. Elegant historical property with lovely lobby and thoughtful, spacious rooms. Big bathroom. There's a restaurant and bar in the building but we didn't visit. The hotel is a one small block walk from great cocktails and dining in the center of downtown. Very walkable area and totally safe. When next in Spokane I will definitely stay here. Reasonable aaa rate too.

data.title: Tons of Character
data.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Spokane Club.  We had a suite, which I thought was very reasonably priced.  It was very large with a king size bed, walk in closet, sofa and two chairs.  It had a bar area with a microwave, mini fridge and coffee make.  They had complementary coffee, tea and bottled water in the rooms.  The bathroom was nice and had a hair dryer.  There was also a full sized ironing board and iron in the closet.  This building is very old, so if you want modern this isn't the place for you.  If charming character is your style, book here.  It is in a great location for walking around downtown.

data.title: 14.00 US for parking a day....not right
data.text: Hotel was ok but having to pay 14.00 US a day for parking isn't fair.  Already paying 160.00+ a night parking should be included.  They have a parkade....but charge you to park in it.  I understand parking is at a premium downtown BUT YOU ALREADY HAVE A PARKADE....PARKING IN IT SHOULD BE FREE!

data.title: Wonderful service, dated but clean
data.text: We stayed here for three nights during a tennis tournament.  The staff was extremely friendly and parking was a breeze ($14 per night but includes unlimited in-out valet parking).  We could walk to the major parts of downtown, including the river walk and convention center.  The common areas are nicely appointed and we enjoyed the historic feel of the hotel. Room service breakfast is reasonably priced and very tasty.  The only downside is that our room (#319), while clean, is very dated.  The furniture and the little bathroom looked like they had not been changed in thirty years!  This did not bother us as we only care about cleanliness, but if you expect a spiffy updated look, be sure to ask if there is a more recently renovated room.

data.title: Can't go wrong!
data.text:
Can't say enough good things. BEST thing about this hotel is the staff. Literally the best customer service every time. We've traveled from Paris, to Mexico to Hawaii and you won't find better people anywhere. 
Clean rooms, free wi-fi and walking distance to Nordys (seriously looking at it out my window as I write this) and a wonderful restaurant. 
See you again soon :0).

data.title: Small room and ever so small bathroom
data.text: Stayed for 3 nights bed was comfortable room was clean had small fridge and brew your own coffee. Bathroom very small and dated. Sink had cracks in it, outside of shower trim had rust and the grout needed to be cleaned. We were in room 319. It was just ok to stay there.

data.title: Not just for members
data.text:
We were booking hotel stays way in advance for our trip from the West coast to Montana. Our first nights stay was in Spokane. Oh my, so many places to choose from. Somehow the Spokane Club caught my fancy. When I consulted with a friend who lives in Spokane, she told me, that she had heard only good things about it, but was afraid, that it would be very expensive. So I called, and was pleasantly surprised to find out, that the rates were better than most other hotels in Spokane. On top of it, the restaurant was rated first class, and open to members and guests only. The room was small, but clean and very nice, it reminded me of a European hotel. A very large closet with terry cloth robes, a nice bar with a modern coffee maker, and even bottled water in the refrigerator. The bathroom was a bit dated, but clean and roomy, plus it held a good size locking closet to store valuables.
The staff was very efficient, from Ryan, Derek and everyone else. And best of all, the valet parking was only $14.00, compared to $50.00 most of the other places demanded. We liked it so much, that we booked a room for our return trip. I certainly will recommend this place to all my friends.

data.title: Value and charm
data.text: This hotel is on the national historical landmark registry and is charming place that is a great vale. Non membever can stay and even with the small fee it is still a great price and it is with in walking distance the Spokane arena so a perfect concert or event hotel to stay. The bar has some great happy hour options for nummy food and drinks.
